snippet: The Dardennes brothers talk about their film "The Kid With a Bike," which Belgium bypassed in its submission for foreign-language Oscar but which is up for a Golden Globe this weekend.
abstract: The Dardennes brothers talk about their film "The Kid With a Bike," which Belgium bypassed in its submission for foreign-language Oscar but which is up for a Golden Globe this weekend.
lead_paragraph: Every year there is at least one movie whose absence from the competition for the Academy Award for best foreign-language film causes critics and fans to question the selection process. Last year it was France's critically acclaimed submission, "Of Gods and Men," which won the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival and many other European awards, but did not get an Oscar nomination or even a spot on the earlier shortlist of nine films.

headline.main: The Dardennes Have an Idea About the Selection Process
